channel.title: Amazon S3 on YT Por
channel.description: Recent content in Amazon S3 on YT Por

item.title: S3cmd on CentOS 7
item.description: S3cmd is a command line tool that we’ve used for uploading, retrieving and managing data in Amazon S3. To install S3cmd, you just need to run the install command. yum install s3cmd

item.title: S3cmd on CentOS 6
item.description: S3cmd is a command line tool that we’ve used for uploading, retrieving and managing data in Amazon S3. To install S3cmd, you would need to download the .repo for the tool, and then, run install. cd /etc/yum.repos.d wget http://s3tools.org/repo/RHEL_6/s3tools.repo yum install s3cmd Answer yes when asked to accept a new GPG key. Note: The latest version of s3cmd requires python 2.6. If you come across this error Problem: ImportError: No module named S3.
